original_title: Bronx: Jerome Avenue - Bedford Park Boulevard
text:
Jerome Avenue, west side (Elevated left), south from Bedford Park Boulevard, showing the land adjacent to the Jerome Park Reservoir. On these grounds were later erected the Bronx buildings of Hunter College. In the left background is the armory on West Kingsbridge Road.

P. L. Sperr

May 8, 1928
Views 1, 2, 3

original_title: Bronx: Jerome Avenue - Bedford Park Boulevard
text:
(1) Jerome Ave. (right, on which elevated structure is seen), west side, north from Bedford Park Boulevard to about West Mosholu Parkway South, showing part of the area adjacent to Jerome Park Reservoir being levelled out. This area is now occupied by the car yards of the City-owned Independent System (Eighth Ave.) Subway. In the left background is visible De Witt Clinton High School. May 8, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, as seen from a point on the cleared area. May 8, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) Another view of the same, at a point farther north. May 8, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

original_title: Bronx: Jerome Avenue - Bedford Park Boulevard
text:
Jerome Ave., west side, south from but not including East 204th Street, to Bedford Park Boulevard, showing the elevated structure of the I.R.T. Jerome Ave.-Woodlawn subway line and its Bedford Park Boulevard station. In the foreground is an Italian vegetable garden.

May 8, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

390-392 Bedford Park Boulevard, south side, between Jerome and Decatur Avenues, showing the Bedford Park Casino, 8th Assembly District headquarters of the American Labor Party.

May 12, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Bronx: Bedford Park Boulevard.

original_title: Bronx: Jerome Avenue - Bedford Park Boulevard
text:
(1)
Jerome Ave. (right, elevated thereon), west side, north from Bedford Park Boulevard (point of vantage), showing the Concourse yard of the City-Owned Independent System subway. Beyond that appears the high service station of the I.R.T. subway system.
May 5, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Another view across the car yard. In the far background is visible De Witt Clinton High School.
May 5, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Carnival: Youngsters making merry at a temporary set-up, on the S.W. corner of Jerome Avenue and Bedford Park Boulevard. The view is northeastward.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from a different angle.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Recreation and hobbies - Carnivals - Bronx.

title: Recreation and hobbies - Carnivals - Bronx.

text:
(1) Carnival: A temporary merrymaking set-up at the S.W. corner of Jerome Avenue and Bedford Park Boulevard; in the Bronx. The view is northeastward.

May 5, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, another view.

May 5, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) Viewing southeastward across the carnival ground.

May 5, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.
